thread.title: PHOTOS: Arctic blast brings frigid weather to East Coast
thread.title_full: PHOTOS: Arctic blast brings frigid weather to East Coast

author: The National News Desk
title: PHOTOS: Arctic blast brings frigid weather to East Coast
text: {p}FRIDAY: Cloudy and windy. Patchy drizzle to isolated light showers possible. Highs will be in the mid 50s. Winds are breezy out of the southeast gusting up to 30 mph.{/p}{p}FRIDAY NIGHT: Showers likely, an isolated t-storm is possible. Lows will be near 50 degrees with SW winds at 10-15 mph.{/p}{p}SATURDAY: A few showers may linger east in the morning. Decreasing clouds by the afternoon. Highs will be in the low to mid 60s, with a light southwesterly wind.{/p}{p}It still appears that rain will end right before the Tulsa Christmas Parade! Any rain that lingers through Saturday morning will be light and likely falling across our southeastern counties. Temperatures will be in the 60s through the weekend. Another system rolls in late Sunday bringing rain and isolated thunderstorms. We'll see a bulk of the rain fall Sunday night through early Monday morning. One more rain chance looks to move across the state next Wednesday.{/p}{p}Available {a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ktul-wx/id489182496\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ktul-wx/id489182496\"}HERE{/a} for iOS Devices from the Apple Store{br}{/p}{p}Available {a
